reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Uberto Pasolini'], 'Producers': ['Ceri Hughes', 'Uberto Pasolini', 'Marco Valerio Pugini', 'Christopher Simon', 'Barnaby Southcombe'], 'Starring': ['Eddie Marsan', 'Joane Froggatt'], 'Studio': ['Redwave Films']} I loved this movie! Such love and devotion John May gave to others freely.
No one should die without acknowledgement of living. Very good movie {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Chris Long', 'Daniel Sackheim', 'Thomas Schlamme', 'Daniel Attias', 'Stefan Schwartz', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Nicole Kassell', 'Adam Arkin', 'Noah Emmerich', 'Matthew Rhys'], 'Starring': ['Keri Russell', 'Matthew Rhys', 'Lev Gorn'], 'Studio': ['FX']} I love this series. Very exciting and stellar acting. Well directed. I always look forward to the next episode. Fine series Better Call Saul Comedy, Drama ['Better Call Saul is the prequel to the award-winning series Breaking Bad, set six years before Saul Goodman (Bob Odenkirk) became Walter White\'s lawyer. When we meet him, the man who will become Saul Goodman is known as Jimmy McGill, a small-time lawyer searching for his destiny, and, more immediately, hustling to make ends meet. Working alongside, and often against, Jimmy is "fixer" Mike Erhm...'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vince Gilligan', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Peter Gould', 'Michael Morris', 'Adam Bernstein', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Colin Bucksey', 'John Shiban', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Terry McDonough'], 'Producers': ['Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould']} I really like Bob Odenkirk's acting. Stellar work! Great Series {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Fawcett', 'David Frazee', 'Ken Girotti', 'T.J. Scott', 'Grant Harvey', 'Helen Shaver', 'Aaron Morton', 'David Wellington', 'Brett Sullivan', 'Chris Grismer'], 'Producers': ['Ivan Schneeberg', 'David Fortier', 'John Fawcett', 'Graeme Manson', 'Alex Levine'], 'Starring': ['Tatiana Maslany', 'Jordan Gavaris', 'Maria Doyle Kennedy'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} The first two seasons were pretty intense, and I loved the acting, but I don't care for where the story is going in season 3. Sorry, you have lost my attention. A good series gone south! Against the Sun Drama, Adventure, Downbeat, Emotional ['In one of the most harrowing true stories of World War II, three US Navy airmen crash land their torpedo bomber in the South Pacific and find themselves on a tiny life raft, surrounded by open ocean. No food. No water. No hope of rescue. Against incredible odds, these three virtual strangers must survive storms, sharks, starvation and each other as they try to sail to safety.'] {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Brian Falk'], 'Producers': ['Brian Falk', 'Mark Moran', 'Joe Ricketts', 'Kurt Graver', 'Luisa Gomez de Silva'], 'Starring': ['Garrett Dillahunt', 'Tom Felton', 'Jake Abel']} A very well-acted and riveting movie! A true story that will feed your appetite for an adventure/survival story. Wonderfully shot true story! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Deutsch', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Français', 'हिन्दी', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português', 'Русский', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Tim Blake Nelson', 'Mike Barker', 'Neasa Hardiman', 'Minkie Spiro', 'Wash Westmoreland'], 'Producers': ['Antonia Elli', 'Christina Ricci', 'Christine Vachon', 'Dawn Prestwich', 'Ian Deithman Kristin', 'Kathy Ciric', 'Lydia Woodward', 'Mike Barker', 'Minkie Spiro', 'Neasa Hardiman', 'Nicole Yorkin', 'Pamela Koffler', 'Rusk Robinson', 'Theresa Anne Fowler', 'Tim Blake Nelson', 'Wash Westmoreland'], 'Starring': ['Christina Ricci', 'David Hoflin'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} I'd like to see more. profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Overall Sentiment**: The user continues to exhibit a positive outlook towards content that explores deep emotional themes and human connections, while also showing increasing discernment in their critiques. They appreciate adventure and survival narratives but express disappointment with ineffective storytelling.

- **Content Preference**: They remain captivated by series and films known for excitement, strong performances, and compelling storytelling that emphasize human resilience. Recent interactions highlight a tendency to provide moderate ratings, as evidenced by the user's low rating of a series despite its mature themes, indicating a critical eye towards excessive violence and overall engagement quality.

- **Tolerance for Mature Themes**: The user is comfortable with mature content that delves into complex human experiences, including substance use and sexual content, but they are becoming more selective about the execution of these themes.

- **Language Preference**: Prefers English audio with English subtitles to enhance clarity and engagement.

- **Engagement with Film and Series**: They value character dedication and emotional depth, consistently favoring high-quality productions. Their enthusiasm for ongoing narratives that foster emotional connections persists, but recent ratings suggest a growing threshold for content that lacks compelling storytelling.

- **Recent Interaction**: The user rated a recent viewing experience poorly, illustrating a willingness to critique even dominant narratives when they fail to meet their expectations for engaging storytelling.
